A.text: The CTE Model Curriculum Standards and Framework for the __________________ Industry Sector are the basis for content of courses offered. Curriculum addresses "Pathway" standards within the program pathway(s) and course sequence.

B.text: Career paths have been identified and can be found on a chart or diagram in the CTE Plan.

C.text: The CTE program has classroom-linked work-based learning and work experience education opportunities through strengthened industry partnerships, effective coordination with Regional Occupation Center/Program (ROC/P), adult schools, Work Experience Education, and Cooperative Work Experience Education programs, and a systematic review of policies and practices addressing barriers to access, including insurance, liability, and other issues.
evidence: List of Work Based Learning (WBL) Sites

D.text: The school master schedule allows students to follow the recommended sequence of CTE courses to complete the selected career path(s).

E.text: Students are provided with a strong experience in and understanding of all aspects of industry.

F.text: Technology is incorporated into program instruction.

G.text: There is collaboration between academic and CTE teachers.

H.text: CTE courses are industry certified, have been submitted to meet high school graduation requirements, University of California a-g (UC a-g) credit, or articulated with a community college.
evidence: Copy of UC A-G Approval List; Articulation Agreements
